 [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רָגַשׁ‎</span>] **verb** ==be in tumult or commotion== (Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***make a vehement noise***; Biblical Aramaic Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎רְגַשׁ‎</span>, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***be disturbed, in tumult*** ([[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] Ithpe\`el often for <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הָמָה‎</span>, as [[Ps.46.6|Ps 46:6]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָׁאָה‎</span> [[Isa.17.12|Isa 17:12]]f.; <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> for <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חָמוֺן‎</span> ***ibid***.); but Syriac usually ***perceive***, so Late Hebrew Hiph\`il, but Hithpa\`el ***fall stormily upon***); — 

**Qal** ***Perfect*** 3 plural [[Ps.2.1|Ps 2:1]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רָֽגְשׁוּ‎</span> why do the nations ***throng tumultuously ?***
